thread.title: Allphones employees face uncertain future with retailer set to go into administration
thread.title_full: Allphones employees face uncertain future with retailer set to go into administration

author: Dan Oakes And Sam Clark
title: Allphones employees face uncertain future with retailer set to go into administration
text:
By the National Reporting Team's Dan Oakes and Sam Clark Updated February 06, 2017 11:01:18 Map: Australia 
The mobile phone retail chain Allphones will go into administration today, leaving hundreds of employees from more than 80 stores across the country uncertain of their future. 
The parent company of the chain, which calls itself "Australia's largest independent telecommunications retailer", announced in 2014 an "impairment" of $25 million after it lost a contract to run 45 Virgin Mobile-branded stores across Australia. 
The write-off came a year after Optus — which owns the Virgin Mobile brand in Australia — withdrew Optus and Virgin products from Allphones stores, further denting the company's bottom line. 
The ABC understands staff are being briefed on the news this morning. 
The news comes a week after the future of two well-known Australian clothing ranges, Marcs and David Lawrence, was thrown into doubt by their parent company going into administration.
